p: The applied drought treatment explained more than 40% of the variation in leaf rolling and drying at both the seedling and tillering stages, while the cultivar was the major determinant of the number of tillers plant âˆ’1 ( Table 2). The combination of drought and cultivar explained more than 45% of the variation in leaf rolling and drying at the seedling and tillering stages ( Table 2). There was no correlation between soil water content in the stressed pots at the end of the drought treatment and leaf rolling or leaf drying.
